result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Timothy E Lemere was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time work, school or combination of the two.
To commit no further criminal acts during the period of the agreement. Not to possess or consume any illicit controlled substances or durg paraphernalia.

Comply with any and all rules of probation and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as part of this case.   Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office.  Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted.  This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assesment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 18 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

$250 fine plus costs on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: 60 days stayed - to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Brett E Reetz in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  State indicates defendant has successfully completed terms of DAGPA, moves to dismiss Ct. 1. Court so orders, dismisses Ct. 1. Bond is no longer in effect.
from DOC Agent Olivia Glesner re: early discharge recommendation
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Timothy E Lemere in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 2 & 3. Court withholds accepting of the plea on Ct. 1 for a period of 2 years to allow defendant the opportunity to complete terms of the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties if defendant would be found guilty of the felony charge. Court reviews DAGPA with defendant, approves and signs agreement. Upon successful completion of DAGPA, State will, after 2 years, move to dismiss Ct. 1. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Bond remains in effect regarding Ct. 1.

Defendant Timothy E Lemere in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz advises defendant is accepting the State's offer, asks court to set a status/plea hearing in 60 days. State has no obejction. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy E Lemere

Prior: 137 Tru Way Rd, Casco, WI 54205

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Not to discuss matter with C.S., B.Z., L.Z., S.Z.
Defense waives reading of Information, based on the charges being the same as in the criminal complaint, and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file Information later today.

Defendant Timothy E Lemere in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/09/15 by Officer Bilodeau.
from Atty Reetz asking court to reschedule 2/09/15 IA because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Initial appearance on February 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
